com.bham.bd.audio

Class ParallelAudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.audio.ParallelAudioPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AudioPlayer

    class ParallelAudioPlayer
extends Object
implements AudioPlayer

    Parallel Audio Player

    Parallel player class to play multiple audio files at the same time. The class is normally used to play multiple layers (stems) of some track which is needed to be analyzed for different effects on different song layers, for example, lyrics, base or instruments.

    NB Each layer must be of the same length and of similar metadata

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private List<AudioAnalyser> ANALYSERS
      List of analysers each media player possesses
      private int countdown
      Number of players to wait before some action could happen (e.g., before ON_END could be fired)
      private CyclicBarrier GATE
      Gate which prevents any player to be started/paused/stopped before each of them are synchronized
      private boolean isPlaying
      Indicates whether this audio player is playing
      private ObjectProperty<Runnable> ON_END
      On end property indicating what method will be run after all tracks finish playing
      private List<MediaPlayer> PLAYERS
      List of media players that are played in parallel

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double volume)
        Description copied from interface: AudioPlayer
        Sets volume for player(-s)

        Note: we don't need to assert the volume is within range [0, 1] because AudioManager will ensure it is withing those bounds. Even if not, MediaPlayer.clamp(double, double, double) ensures the proper range.

        Specified by:
        setVolume in interface AudioPlayer
        Parameters:
        volume - value between 0 and 1 indicating new volume
